result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryan M Morton in court.  Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Bryan M Morton.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have a joint agreement, Attorney Emick requests 90 days, no objection by the state. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 01:15 pm.

2:03 PM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bryan M Morton in court.  Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court for Bryan M Morton. 
Atty Kennedy states the deft is completing counseling and asks for a status in 60 days. 
No objection. 
Status hearing set for 10/11/22 @ 1:15pm, 2560.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:05 PM (64-05)  Defendant Bryan M Morton in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Andrew Herrmann in court.  Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court for Bryan M Morton. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Kennedy acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Letter to Court re: adjournment due to counsel's unavailability

Vivien TenHakken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bryan Michael Morton in court. Right to attorney options form given; defendant referred to SPD. State asking for one week to file complaint. Defendant lives in TN. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Order to seal - notice of arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
